meanings.definition: The quality of being acute or sharp in perception or intellect.
meanings.sent1: Her acutenesses in understanding complex concepts impressed her teachers.
meanings.sent2: His acutenesses in noticing small details made him a great detective.
meanings.sent3: The acutenesses of her mind were like a finely tuned instrument, always ready to learn.
meanings.sent4: The acutenesses of his intellect were like a double-edged sword, cutting through confusion.
meanings.sent5: The acutenesses of her perception were so keen that she could see things others missed.

meanings.definition: The severity or intensity of a situation or feeling.
meanings.sent1: The acutenesses of the storm left a trail of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent2: The acutenesses of his pain were evident in the way he winced with every step.
meanings.sent3: The acutenesses of the situation made them realize the gravity of the matter.
meanings.sent4: The acutenesses of her anger were like a raging fire, consuming everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The acutenesses of the fear in his eyes were palpable, showing the depth of his terror.
